div.style: z-index: 8; white-space: normal; font-size: 20px; line-height: 22px; font-weight: 400; color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 1.00);

h3.strong: Benzie County Central Schools is a premier school district located in beautiful Northwestern Lower Michigan offering world class programs. For more information, please contact 231-882-9653.

div.h3:
♦️”Beating the Odds” District
♦️Mackinaw Center CAP Recognized
♦️US News and World Report Silver Medal Winner
♦️College Board AP Honor Roll

div.p:
Dr. Lyle Simmons Ph.D., University of Michigan Associate Professor of Molecular, Cellular, and Developmental Biology along with Benzie Central Alumni and University of Michigan graduate and PhD candidate,Taylor Nye visited our Biology Department here at Benzie Central this past December. Take a moment to enjoy this video on “This is Michigan | Examining Their Possibilities.” Mrs. Huddleston and several of her students were interviewed. This was an amazing opportunity for our school and students.
Our Biology Department continues to make us proud here at Benzie Central. When looking at data over the last three years, 67% of our Benzie students have scored a 4 or 5 on their exams versus only 27.6 % of the Nation.
Point of Pride, for sure! Click on photo below for complete video.

All schools have a wide range of academic options designed to help each student realize his or her individual potential. Curriculum is carefully selected to ensure our students are getting the very best academic experience.

Our award-winning band, choir, theatre, and visual arts programs are indicative of not only our excellent facilities (including one of the finest auditorium spaces in the region), but of our commitment to these critical programs.

All schools are well-connected and equipped to promote incorporation of technology into the lives of our students. Each building has a robust wireless network and newer devices for use in and out of the classroom.

Our Benzie Central Huskies have a strong winning tradition with a wide range of offerings and opportunities to make sure that ALL students have a chance to get involved and represent their school with pride.

Benzie Central Schools are committed to helping ALL students get involved. To that end we work with our community to provide many opportunities for students to get involved in a wide range of clubs and activities to suit the diverse interests of our student body.

Our dedicated teachers and counseling staff help each of our students plan for success beyond high school. All students engage in career and college planning through an individualized process designed to help our students be successful in whatever path they choose.

p.strong: Benzie Central High School is a 2020 Best High School,
based on rankings from U.S. News & World Report
